abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Investment Guarantee
            Facility Project for Afghanistan were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            Afghanistan's environment is challenging for Foreign
            Direct Investment (FDI), in particular the worsening
            security environment and governance. Availability of
            political risk guarantee is not enough to mitigate the
            concerns of foreign investors. Without minimum peace and
            security, long-term investments are difficult to attract.
            The Afghanistan Investment Guarantee Facility (AIGF)
            marketing activities will have been further improved by
            hiring a local marketing representative, familiar with local
            investment and business environment as well as political
            risk insurance products. The previous operation of
            Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA) in Bosnia
            and Herzegovina highlighted the importance of having a
            full-time representative working on the ground to increase
            awareness and liaise with investors on a continuing basis;
            once a special representative was placed in-country, there
            was a steady flow of inquiries from foreign investors for
            guarantees. In addition, local representative can help MIGA
            staff in headquarters to better understand the risks
            involved in the country since more detailed information can
            be provided. This greatly helps in the management of risks
            in a high-risk environment.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Investment Guarantee Facility
            objective is to assist Afghanistan in its reconstruction
            efforts by stimulating foreign investment through a program
            of political risk insurance - in an environment where the
            perception of political risk (risks of war and civil
            disturbance, expropriation, transfer restriction and breach
            of contract) by foreign investors remains high. Under this
            project, IDA will provide a credit to the Government of
            Afghanistan for an Investment Guarantee Facility which will
            be administered and implemented by MIGA. The Facility '
            s capital base will be made up of cash contributions from
            IDA and others to be disbursed into an interest bearing
            Trust Fund. Investors will pay premiums and MIGA, as
            Administrator, will issue contracts of guarantee on behalf
            of the Facility. All guarantees supported by the Guarantee
            Facility will follow MIGA's regular underwriting
            procedures and methodologies, and will be able to offer
            coverage against the following risks: transfer restriction
            and inconvertibility, expropriation, war and civil
            disturbance and breach of contract. The guarantees will be
            priced to risk, in accordance with MIGA's pricing
            methodology and guarantee contracts will have a maximum
            duration of seven years. In view of the need for flexibility
            in Afghanistan's conflict-effected environment, it is
            proposed that the Guarantee Facility be able to support the
            following transactions generally ineligible under
            MIGA's regular policies: a) foreign loans without
            equity, to be used to finance a local equity investment or
            the importation of critical capital goods for
            reconstruction; and b) local loans provided in a freely
            convertible currency by a foreign financial institution in Afghanistan.
